jobs_description: Are you a Data Scientist interested in further developing your professional experience while contributing to ending global hunger? Are you passionate about helping those in need? Would you like to join a global organisation investing in its people? If so, an exciting & fulfilling career awaits you!!! Join our diverse and passionate team that works on varied and international projects directly contributing to saving & changing millions of lives around the globe. DEADLINE FOR APPLICATIONS Applications must be submitted by Sunday, May 5th, 2024 (11:59 PM CET) ORGANIZATIONAL CONTEXT The position is based in Rome and reports to the Data Science Team Leader. It is within the Office of Internal Audit (OIGA), under the Office of the Inspector General (OIG). OIGA provides WFP stakeholders with independent and objective assurance and advisory services designed to address the main risks to WFP operations and help WFP achieve its goals through improvements to the effectiveness of its governance, risk management, and controls. OIGA has its own Data Science team, whose mission is to support internal auditors. THE ROLE The Data Scientist primarily designs and develops Data Science products with the overarching goal of assisting internal auditors, and may be occasionally involved in internal audits when complex data analyses are required. The Data Scientist gathers data-driven insights, which directly improve audit assignments to assess the soundness, adequacy and application of internal management and financial controls. KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES (not all-inclusive) Explores, identifies, and acquires data sources to determine their suitability for risk assessments, audits, and investigations. Enables broader use of data sources by applying quality methods to structure, clean, format, parse, and standardize for analytical use. Establishes a close working relationship with members of the OIGA team and key clients to leverage Data Science methods to support their assurance activities with solutions that assist them in accomplishing their mandates. Designs and develops Data Science products to reveal insights and provide an understanding or knowledge of the data that would otherwise not be detected without the application of advanced analytical methods such as Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, predictive analytics, data/text mining, Natural Language Processing, statistics, and the use of relevant algorithms and computational approaches. Promotes the use of Data Science solutions, for instance by organizing ad-hoc trainings to teach OIGA auditors how to best use visualizations developed within the team. Designs and develops custom visualizations and presentations to reveal the findings of analysis for clients, suitable for all forms of production (including briefings, reports, documentation to OIGA, interactive interfaces, and publication of quality outputs). At the request of OIGA management and in coordination with the Data Science Team Leader, participates in internal audits and investigations, assisting and performing tasks under the supervision of auditors and investigators, producing findings and reports within the stipulated timeline and quality requirements. Guides, trains, and supervises more junior staff with function. QUALIFICATIONS & KEY REQUIREMENTS Education: Advanced University degree (Master's degree or equivalent) in Data Science, Engineering, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Physics, Astrophysics, or a related field Experience: 5 years of relevant, progressively responsible experience in Data Science and/or Data Engineering Language: Fluency (level C) in English language. Intermediate knowledge (level B) of a second official UN language: Arabic, Chinese, French, Russian, Spanish, and/or Portuguese (a WFP working language). MORE ABOUT YOU Advanced knowledge of Python Advanced knowledge of Machine Learning algorithms & tools Advanced knowledge of SQL Knowledge of data visualization tools & strong visualization skills Knowledge of databases & data modelling techniques Experience designing & implementing ETL processes Strong communication skills Desirable: Experience analyzing data in support of oversight activities TERMS AND CONDITIONS This is an International Professional position and is open to all nationalities . Mobility is and continues to be a core contractual requirement in WFP. This position is however classified as ‚Äúnon-rotational‚Äù which means the incumbent shall not be subject to the regular reassignment process unless the position is reclassified as rotational. The selected candidate will be employed on a fixed-term contract with a probationary period of one year. This position is open to both internal and external candidates. WFP offers an attractive compensation and benefits package in line with ICSC standards ( http://icsc.un.org ) including basic salary, post adjustment, relocation entitlement, visa, travel and shipment allowances, 30 days‚Äô annual leave, home leave, an education grant for dependent children, a pension plan, and medical insurance. The selected candidate will be required to relocate to Rome, Italy to take up this assignment.

jobs_description: About Michael & Associates Michael & Associates is a rapidly growing criminal defense firm seeking to hire a Director of Data Analytics. This will be the first full-time analytics hire for the firm and will play a big role in the company‚Äôs growth. But before we jump into it, let‚Äôs answer the obvious question: why is a criminal defense law firm seeking a Director of Analytics? We‚Äôre taking a different approach to the legal industry. Criminal defense, in particular, is about as archaic as it gets. It‚Äôs an industry of solo practitioners, where filing cabinets and paper letters are still common and the lack of technology, analytics, and best business practices result in poor client experience. Michael & Associates is here to change that. We are leveraging technology & data analytics to create a new type of criminal defense firm. If that sounds interesting to you, read on. What makes this role so awesome: Chance to Build Something from the Ground Up: Michael & Associates is rapidly growing, and you‚Äôll be part of that growth. You‚Äôll be responsible for creating all of the data structure, reporting, and processes from the ground up. Solve Tough Problems: There‚Äôs no shortage of interesting, challenging problems to solve with data. Report to a Data Literate Manager: Our team includes many people who have scaled teams ranging from startups to public companies, and we are no strangers to the use of data. You‚Äôll have the support of a team that gets data and is hungry to use data to make business decisions. Clean Data: Michael & Associates has a data warehouse that stores all of our data, and we‚Äôve thought about data integrity from day one. Help People: Every day, we help people get through one of the worst experiences of their lives. By leveraging data, we believe we can provide the highest level of client service in the industry. Responsibilities: Business Problem-Solving Skills: You are great at distilling down the ‚Äòso what‚Äô. In addition to data wrangling, you‚Äôll be asking questions and proactively finding insights and opportunities. Advanced Level at SQL & Data Wrangling: You can write SQL in your sleep. You know how to do complex joins, window functions, and all the cool tricks. You understand how to take messy data and turn it into something useful. Data Engineering & Dictionary: You can use tools like DBT to create tables that we can maintain and reuse, and you‚Äôre able to document everything for scalability‚Äôs sake. Tableau / Data Visualization: You‚Äôre familiar with the power of data visualization and how to present data in a way that end users can cut, filter, manipulate, and solve problems. Strong Data Integrity Intuition: We do our best to keep the data clean, but as we all know, no data is perfect. You know how to look at a set of tables and make sense of them. You can test your assumptions, and do gut checks on ‚ÄòDoes this make sense‚Äô? When we create data pipelines, you‚Äôll be the one making sure that data is transferred from one source to another properly.

Company Overview GEP is a diverse, creative team of people passionate about procurement. We invest ourselves entirely in our client‚Äôs success, creating strong collaborative relationships that deliver extraordinary value year after year. Our clients include market global leaders with far-flung international operations, Fortune 500 and Global 2000 enterprises, leading government and public institutions. We deliver practical, effective services and software that enable procurement leaders to maximise their impact on business operations, strategy and financial performance. That‚Äôs just some of the things that we do in our quest to build a beautiful company, enjoy the journey and make a difference. GEP is a place where individuality is prized, and talent respected. We‚Äôre focused on what is real and effective. GEP is where good ideas and great people are recognized, results matter, and ability and hard work drive achievements. We‚Äôre a learning organization, actively looking for people to help shape, grow and continually improve us. Are you one of us? GEP is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, ethnicity, color, national origin, religion, sex, disability status, or any other characteristics protected by law. We are committed to hiring and valuing a global diverse work team. For more information please visit us on GEP.com or check us out on LinkedIn.com. What You Will Do As an Analyst - Data and Analytics, you will be responsible for developing and maintaining R scripts to support various data processing and analysis tasks within our team. Your expertise in R programming will be instrumental in automating repetitive tasks, performing statistical analysis, and building custom functions to enhance our data processing capabilities. Responsibilities include: Writing efficient and scalable R scripts to manipulate, clean, and analyze time series data; Collaborating with data scientists and analysts to implement statistical models and algorithms in R; Optimizing code performance and ensuring code reliability through rigorous testing and validation; Providing technical support and troubleshooting assistance to team members working with R-based tools and packages; Staying updated on the latest developments in the R programming language and integrating new features into our workflow. What You Should Bring Education: Graduation in Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field with a strong emphasis on and data analysis. Specialized coursework in R programming and statistical analysis is desirable. Desirable Skills Expertise in R programming language and its ecosystem, including packages for data manipulation, visualization, and statistical analysis; Proficiency in scripting and automating data processing tasks using RStudio or similar integrated development environments; Familiarity with version control systems for managing and collaborating on R code repositories; Attention to detail and the ability to write efficient, modular, and maintainable code. Credentials/Differentiators Demonstrated experience in developing R-based solutions for data analysis, statistical modeling, or data visualization projects; Contributions to the R community, such as package development, participation in forums or meetups, or contributions to open-source projects; Completion of relevant online courses or workshops in R programming and statistical analysis.

jobs_description: Company Overview: Lean Tech is a rapidly expanding organization situated in Medell√≠n, Colombia. Demonstrate excellent communication and stakeholder management skills with peer-level, executive, and all engineering levels. Be responsive, flexible, creative, open to change, and have a high degree of initiative. Work across the enterprise to understand dependencies with other applications, cross-team solutions, and enterprise best practices and direction. Proactively break down silos to envision and co-create products with cross-team, cross-company communication and collaboration. Ensure an open and collaborative technical environment with other Solution Architects, Enterprise Architects, and Engineers. Work independently and collaboratively with a team(s). Solution Domain: Demonstrate strong conceptual and problem-solving skills. Know the details of the entire solution's architecture, topology, and integrations. Understand what tools are used, processes in place, failover strategies, and environment/connectivity patterns. Understand the interdependencies of the team's solutions with other enterprise applications. Document topology/solution architecture for current state, as well as topology/solution for future state. Provide proposed arch designs/patterns/diagrams for new solution integrations. Document decisions/designs via ADRs. Understand the broader ecosystem and how business processes work. Incorporate this knowledge and connect the dots for the engineers. Technical Domain: Follow roadmap/product roadmap and releases of vendor technology used by their team. Understand when new functionality is becoming available, how it could impact/improve team solutions as well as overall solution architecture. Work with vendors to articulate additional product enhancements needed or desired. Influence product roadmaps. Work with vendors to articulate product issues/challenges, help teams to get to resolution. Have hands-on working knowledge of coding languages that the teams utilize. Have extensive experience and knowledge with technologies and products the teams utilize or will need to utilize. Stay up to date with these technologies through training and research. Investigate new technologies and techniques and research ongoing industry developments through a partnership with the Enterprise Architecture team. Partner with the leadership team in identifying gaps and providing improvement strategies to foster continuous improvement. Ability to dive into the code and propose recommendations to an issue or adjustments as needed. Engage in critical support situations and effectively, efficiently, and quickly drive to successful resolutions. Ensure teams are documenting and following best practices around security, data access, design standards, and coding standards. Propose and guardrails to monitor/enforce adherence. Ensure teams designs and processes are reusable and eliminate redundancy. Planning/Budget: Partner with the manager for financial planning and budgeting for technology investments and software expenses. Provide input and guidance to ensure cost management and spend on technology. Support talent identification, growth plans/opportunities, mentors. Create/maintain technology roadmaps (short and long term) - looking at future tech solutions (or plan b items), technical debt to address, future arch states and improvements to help meet business needs. Ability to turn vague concepts into actionable work groupings that the team can further refine and break down. Evaluate the ROI of systems development and enhancements to the IT Enterprise environment and effectively weigh the financial alternatives involved with various technical solutions and proposals. Contracts/Proof of Concepts(POC): Can create, lead, and execute POCs as needed. Including identification of POC Success criteria/score carding, and leading vendor assessments and discussions Ability to review technical components of a legal contract and provide insights/recommended change or updates Requirements & Qualifications: Platform is Snowflake and Azure Data Factory Can be able to ‚Äúwhiteboard‚Äù on solution architecture and roll up sleeves on hands-on engineering Exposure to enterprise architecture and integrations, familiarity with ADRs, and relevant product enhancement knowledge. -Proven experience in solution architecture preferably in Snowflake and Azure Data Factory platforms. Excellent hands-on technical skills in coding languages. Extensive experience in cloud systems, data architecture, and pipeline design. Strong knowledge of contemporary technology trends through training and research. Proficiency in creating and executing POCs. Certifications in Snowflake and Azure Data Factory platform would be advantageous. Ability to handle contracts and provide technical insights. Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills. Why you will love Lean Tech: Join a powerful tech workforce and help us change the world through technology Professional development opportunities with international customers Collaborative work environment Career path and mentorship programs that will lead to new levels. Join Lean Tech and contribute to shaping the data landscape within a dynamic and growing organization. Your skills will be honed, and your contributions will play a vital role in our continued success. Lean Tech is an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

jobs_description: Bring your ideas to work where innovation comes in all forms. Curitiba - PR At the Electrolux Group, as a leading global appliance company, we strive every day to shape living for the better for our consumers, our people and our planet. We share ideas and collaborate so that together, we can develop solutions that deliver enjoyable and sustainable living. Come join us as you are. We believe diverse perspectives make us stronger and more innovative. In our global community of people from 100+ countries, we listen to each other, actively contribute and grow together. Join us in our exciting quest to build the future home! All about the role: Here in the Electrolux Group, we‚Äôve gone far beyond making things better, developing and manufacturing products to meet our consumers‚Äô demands in matters of taste, care and wellbeing. Around the world and across many sites and sectors, our production teams are proactively working to optimize manufacturing systems. Our continuous improvement teams work to guarantee maximum efficiency and accuracy in our processes, identifying and eliminating waste, and bringing over new technologies and the best practices in the market. What you'll do: As a Labour Efficiency Specialist, you will coordinate and integrate the efficiency projects within Latin America, in collaboration with the Global Labour Efficiency Team. If you have great organizational and analytical skills, can easily communicate and collaborate with others, and are always up to date with the latest technologies and trends, this is your chance! Help Electrolux keep shaping living for the better, and we'll help you fly higher than ever before. In detail, you will: Implement and contribute to implementation of efficient labor resources management following the company's continuous improvement methodology; Implement Standard Time definition for different processes and products following standard methodologies; Verify correct definition of Routings vs Line Balance and organization of Direct and Indirect Labor; Establish yearly Direct Labor Efficiency improvement plans according to labor map methodology, elaborating and implementing indicators and team-level management in each LA plant; Develop and drive collaboration community for Labor Efficiency across the Business Area; Run and coordinate trainings for Methods-Time Engineers concerning Electrolux standards; Drive time measurement methodology and safe and ergonomic workplace design across the region, acting as a reference point for global teams as well as taking charge of implementation at the LATAM Food Preservation Product Lines. As part of the culture of continuous improvement, you will be involved in Lean Thinking projects and activities (EMS/C2W). Who you are: You have: - Bachelor's degree in Engineering (Mechanical, Materials) or equivalent (Master's is a plus); - EMS Green Gear/Green Win; - Solid experience within the Manufacturing Engineering area with strong knowledge of Methods-Time Measurement production concepts; - Solid experience with project management, working with multifunctional teams; - Experience with multicultural teams; - Knowledge of production organization and daily production routines; - Knowledge of product and process documentation and data management; - Advanced English. Where you'll be: You will be based at the Guabirotuba plant in Curitiba. One of the focal points for all Latin American Electrolux operations, this plant is the base for over 3000 collaborators, all focused on transforming the way the world lives by shaping lives for the better with their work. It will be necessary to be available for frequent travel. In order to create a culture of inclusion and care for everyone's wellbeing, we offer the following benefits: - Flexible work hours/hybrid work environment; - Discounts on our award-winning Electrolux products and services; - Profit share bonus; - Insurance policy plan; - Extensive learning opportunities and flexible career path; We also offer 6-month maternity leave and extended paternity leave of at least 28 days ; this new benefit is the result of a global guideline and ensures the recognition of all our employees - no matter who they are, in which country they work, or which role they play in the company. As part of the Electrolux Group, we will continuously invest in you and your development. There are no barriers to where your career could take you.

jobs_description: Job Description Data and Documentation Control Administrators At Nextracker, we are leading in the energy transition, providing the most comprehensive portfolio of intelligent solar tracker and control software solutions for solar power plants, as well as strategic services to capture the full value of solar power plants for our customers. Our talented worldwide teams are transforming PV plant performance every day with smart technology, data monitoring and analysis services. As a company driving the clean energy transition, sustainability is not just a word. It's a core part of our business and our operations. Our sustainability efforts are based on five cornerstones: People, Community, Environment, Innovation, and Integrity. We are creative, collaborative and passionate problem-solvers from diverse backgrounds, driven by our shared mission to provide smart solar and software solutions for our customers and to mitigate climate change for future generations. Make your mark with Nextracker. Job Description: Manage data integrity, security and access in our PLM system including issuing item numbers for product/documentation, item creation, change requests, change orders creation, reporting, attribute maintenance, active item list and end of life maintenance, integration and data extracts, supporting automation initiatives and support data integrity into downstream tools. We Are Looking For Someone Who Demonstrates Intense collaboration Passionate customer focus Thoughtful, fast, disciplined execution Tenacious commitment to continuous improvement Relentless drive to win Duties Include And Not Limited To Data integrity and security, and accurate maintenance of product lifecycle data in our Engineering and management tools. Accurate item record creation including consistent naming convention, data fields selections, change order creation including consistent summary and description, linking relevant processes to the items or changes. Data entry into database, including creation of requests and change orders per company approval and tracking process. Also includes tasks such as reports, testing and subsequent write ups, and mass database updates via CSV upload Special projects such as problem solving and improving processes. Skills Required Critical thinker: able to sort out complex problems and voice potential solutions Team player: able to work with a varied team and other departments, get along with others; also must be able to both work independently or take direction as the situation calls for it Experience with Solidworks and other design drafting tools, with ability to follow best practices and good standards as it pertains to maintaining relevant data on the document or drawing and uploading files into database. Experienced with Product Lifecycle Management systems, bonus if experienced with tools such as Arena, NetSuite, Salesforce Minimum 2 years of database maintenance experience, or equivalent university program experience may be considered. At Nextracker, we are leading in the energy transition, providing the most comprehensive portfolio of intelligent solar tracker and software solutions for solar power plants, as well as strategic services to capture the full value of solar power plants for our customers. Our talented worldwide teams are transforming PV plant performance every day with smart technology, data monitoring and analysis services. For us at Nextracker, sustainability is not just a word. It's a core part of our business, values and our operations. Our sustainability efforts are based on five cornerstones: People, Community, Environment, Innovation, and Integrity. jobs_description: We are a startup dedicated to transforming the legal profession and the delivery of justice through data. titulo: Director, Global Process Excellence, Requisition to Pay (R2P)
jobs_description: Building on our past. Ready for the future Worley is a global professional services company of energy, chemicals and resources experts headquartered in Australia.? Right now, we‚Äôre bridging two worlds as we accelerate to more sustainable energy sources, while helping our customers provide the energy, chemicals and resources that society needs now. We partner with our customers to deliver projects and create value over the life of their portfolio of assets. We solve complex problems by finding integrated data-centric solutions from the first stages of consulting and engineering to installation and commissioning, to the last stages of decommissioning and remediation. Join us and help drive innovation and sustainability in our projects. The Role The Director, Global Process Excellence, Requisition to Pay (R2P) will set our global vision and strategy for Worley‚Äôs end-to-end Requisition to Pay (R2P) Processes, own the process design to drive optimisation, performance and compliance across all geographies, functions, and business units, leveraging the delivery capability in the organisation to enable Worley‚Äôs strategic aspirations. Establish our vision and drive strategic direction, optimize Worley‚Äôs end-to-end processes, and create a greater experience for our people. The Director, Global Process Excellence will have significant authority, to fundamentally shift the way processes are owned and managed at Worley. Be a critical enabler in the establishment of a global process framework at Worley. Focus on end-to-end process design, documentation, and architecture including data, controls, and policies. R2P Process Design Benchmark processes and identify gaps Define global process taxonomy and design including controls, master data governance standards and end-to-end process Continuous improvement in process design Documentation of global process blueprints, procedures, local exceptions, and changes R2P Process Oversight Oversee the monitoring and analysis of process compliance and performance Establish and maintain process-level master data standards Monitor process audit outcomes, and projects across process area to inform and drive improvement initiatives R2P Programme & Project Management Review and approve or reject projects based on strategic relevance and feasibility Initiate project launch, case for change, outline project plan, change management and resourcing Continuous monitoring of inflight transformation Accountable for budget for end-to-end transformation initiatives About You A seasoned professional with significant deep, global, end-to-end Requisition to Pay (R2P) process expertise. A leader who thrives in a global, complex and matrix organisation. A proven track record of managing complex programme portfolios and delivering measurable success. Excellence in process improvement, change management, Agile Methodology, Six Sigma, Lean, Innovation Methodology, and Design Thinking (a certification is desirable). You must possess end-to-end process ownership, and management methodologies and consistently drive process improvements. Utilise process mapping, analysis, and optimisation techniques to identify and implement improvements, and streamline operations. You are familiar with ERP systems, workflow automation tools, and data management systems coupled with a strong understanding of IT governance and security principles. Experience in utilizing data analytics tools and techniques to drive process insights. Knowledge of KPIs and metrics used to measure process performance. As a strategic thinker, you can identify innovative solutions and drive successful outcomes. Experience in aligning process improvements with strategic objectives, familiar with business strategy frameworks and methodologies. Strong problem-solving and critical-thinking skills that enable you to address complex process challenges. Your communication and work style enable you to influence and engage stakeholders at all levels and gain by-in and successful outcomes. A dynamic leadership style who successfully leads cross-functional teams. Sophisticated ability to develop and execute change management strategies to ensure successful implementation of new processes. Highly proficient in Microsoft Suite, especially in Excel and PowerPoint. Experience in working with relevant tech platforms to enable process optimisation. Qualifications - degree or higher-level business qualification/s in Business Administration, Accounting, Finance or relevant functional area Moving forward together We want our people to be energized and empowered to drive sustainable impact. So, our focus is on a values-inspired culture that unlocks brilliance through belonging, connection and innovation. We‚Äôre building a diverse, inclusive and respectful workplace. Creating a space where everyone feels they belong, can be themselves, and are heard. And we're not just talking about it; we're doing it. We're reskilling our people, leveraging transferable skills, and supporting the transition of our workforce to become experts in today's low carbon energy infrastructure and technology. Whatever your ambition, there‚Äôs a path for you here. And there‚Äôs no barrier to your potential career success. Join us to broaden your horizons, explore diverse opportunities, and be part of delivering sustainable change. jobs_description: Join the CloudWalk Wolfpack as a MLOps Engineer. Your Mission: At CloudWalk, we're at the cutting edge of AI, pioneering the use of Large Language Models (LLMs) and Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) to drive innovation. As a MLOps Engineer, you will play a critical role in operationalizing the visionary work of our LLM Data Scientists. Your expertise will ensure the smooth deployment, efficient management, and scalable performance of LLMs across our extensive infrastructure. Your contributions will turn advanced AI research into scalable, high-performance solutions, with a particular focus on optimizing network communication and parallel processing capabilities. What You‚Äôll Do: Deploy and Manage LLMs: Employ Kubernetes, Terraform, and cloud services to deploy and scale LLMs efficiently, ensuring their adaptability to high-demand scenarios. Optimize Computing Infrastructure: Focus on enhancing GPU utilization, distributed training, bandwidth efficiency between machines, and VPC connections to maximize system performance. Leverage Cutting-Edge Technologies: Utilize libraries such as Hugging Face's Accelerate and PyTorch's torchrun to facilitate parallel training across multiple machines in a cluster, optimizing our AI models' training and inference processes. Collaborate on Innovation: Partner with our R&D team to transition LLM and RAG technologies from conceptual stages to scalable, production-ready systems. Monitor and Improve System Performance: Implement advanced monitoring and logging practices to ensure system reliability and performance, continuously seeking improvements. Stay Updated on Industry Advances: Actively pursue the latest developments in MLOps, cloud computing, and AI technologies to implement innovative solutions and maintain our infrastructure's leading edge. Technologies You Will Work With: Kubernetes, Terraform, and cloud computing platforms for scalable AI model deployment. CI/CD pipelines, Git for version control, and Bash scripting for operational efficiency. Hugging Face's Accelerate and PyTorch's torchrun for parallel training and optimization across multiple machines. A comprehensive understanding of network infrastructure to optimize bandwidth and secure VPC connections is essential. What We Expect From You: Technical Mastery: Solid experience with DevOps, cloud infrastructure, and deploying machine learning models. Expertise in network optimization and parallel computing is crucial. Problem-Solving Mindset: The ability to navigate complex challenges, strategically manage resources, and improve system efficiency. Collaborative Approach: Strong communication skills and the ability to contribute effectively within a dynamic, interdisciplinary team. Lifelong Learner: A commitment to continuous learning, staying abreast of the latest technological advancements, and applying innovative solutions. Why CloudWalk? By joining CloudWalk, you become part of a team that's reshaping the future with technological innovations. We cherish creativity, teamwork, and a dedication to excellence. Here, your work contributes to a mission of driving forward technological advancements. Dare to innovate, dare to impact, dare to join the Wolfpack. Apply now!

jobs_description: Company Description Visa is a world leader in digital payments, facilitating more than 215 billion payments transactions between consumers, merchants, financial institutions and government entities across more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses and economies to thrive. When you join Visa, you join a culture of purpose and belonging ‚Äì where your growth is priority, your identity is embraced, and the work you do matters. We believe that economies that include everyone everywhere, uplift everyone everywhere. Your work will have a direct impact on billions of people around the world ‚Äì helping unlock financial access to enable the future of money movement. Join Visa: A Network Working for Everyone. Job Description Visa is seeking a team member based in Sao Paulo who will play a pivotal role in developing and implementing campaign measurement methodologies and processes for both client and core Visa LAC marketing campaigns. The role encompasses leading third-party vendor teams to measure the impact of these campaigns. The role involves hands-on activities such as the development and execution of campaign measurement methodologies and processes, using either traditional or advanced statistical and automation approaches. It also involves creating documentation, as well as aligning presenting and negotiating with internal stakeholders. Specific Responsibilities For This Role Include Design, develop and deploy standard methods and processes for measuring the performance and impact of Visa LAC client and core marketing campaigns. Automation of measurement solutions and models. Design and develop automation of measurement solutions and models using various tools and technologies, as well as optimize and improve the performance and quality of automation solutions and processes. Leverage Visa data, technology, and industry expertise to ensure consistent and accurate measurement of marketing campaigns across LAC. Keep abreast of the latest trends and best practices in marketing measurement and analytics, and present new ideas to enhance Visa's current measurement capabilities. Align the data and insights with the business objectives, understand the challenges and opportunities, and provide actionable recommendations based on the measurement results. Collaborate with both internal and external stakeholders to define the scope and objectives of the analysis and initiatives that support marketing campaign measurement. Lead and manage third-party vendor teams to deliver timely and quality measurement reports and insights for Visa LAC core and client campaigns. This is a hybrid position. Hybrid employees can alternate time between both remote and office. Employees in hybrid roles are expected to work from the office 2-3 set days a week (determined by leadership/site), with a general guidepost of being in the office 50% or more of the time based on business needs. Qualifications Basic Qualifications 8+ years of relevant work experience with a Bachelor‚Äôs Degree or at least 5 years of experience with an Advanced Degree (e.g. Masters, MBA, JD, MD) or 2 years of work experience with a PhD, OR 11+ years of relevant work experience. Preferred Qualifications 9 or more years of relevant work experience with a Bachelor Degree or 7 or more relevant years of experience with an Advanced Degree (e.g. Masters, MBA, JD, MD) or 3 or more years of experience with a PhD BA, BS required. MBA or other relevant Masters degree preferred (eg: Statistics, Computer Science, and Engineering). More than 8 years of relevant industry experience in analytics CRM in a leading commercial brand or management consulting (with relevant industry experience in retail, financial services, payment), or retail banking management experience. Previous experience on studies on consumer behavior, marketing campaign targeting and effectiveness and CLTV. Experience in big data analytics and statistical modeling in SAS including SAS E. Miner, SAS E. Guide and SPSS. Work with large volumes of data. Extract and manipulate large datasets using standard tools such as Hadoop Ecosystem, Apache Spark, SAS, through scripting in Python, SQL, Java etc. Hands-on skills in cleaning, manipulating, analyzing, visualizing and modeling large data sets. Transform data and analysis to executive business language . Ability to lead and mentor diverse teams of data scientists, engineers, and other technical professionals Continuously develop and present innovative ideas based on data driven approach in order to improve current business practices within Visa. Excellent project management and organizational and presentational skills. Self-motivated, results oriented individual with the ability to handle numerous projects concurrently. Ideal candidates should be motivated, data-driven, and analytic, capable of delivering strategic thought leadership, diagnosing problems, and providing high-impact solutions to support business growth and performance. Candidates should also have solid experience in developing enduring, strategic relationships across the Visa organization. Additional Information Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.

jobs_description: BRP is looking for a Data Analyst to join its team and take the global analytical practice to the next level. Define and implement the architecture elements that will ensure the timeliness, quality, security and availability of data Continuously improve the BI platform architecture, from raw data capture to the presentation layer Be a leader in defining best practices and creative thinking YOU‚ÄôLL THRIVE IN THIS ROLE IF YOU HAVE THE FOLLOWING SKILLS AND QUALITIES: Master Degree in Business Intelligence or equivalent Solid and demonstrated experience on following various modeling techniques: Relational Dimensional Data Vault 2.0 Team-worker, open-minded and always willing to discuss the proposed model or approach to be taken Highly organized, able to build a "game plan", and prioritize own tasks with conflicting delivery dates Constantly comes up with creative ideas for improvement, and loves to get my hands on new technologies. Excellent oral and written communicator, in French and English, able to prepare and make executive presentations Experience in working in an agile delivery model Experience with SAP is a plus THE ROAD SHOULD BELONG TO EVERYONE. We still live in a world where many feel the road is for other people. We believe we can make a difference. Moving people goes beyond making innovative products. We strive to nurture our people‚Äôs aspirations, to exceed our riders‚Äô expectations and stand in solidarity with all the communities that ride with us. Building a more inclusive BRP with no barriers for those who seek to ride starts from within, and we need everyone's commitment, drive and dedication to make it a reality. WELCOME TO BRP We‚Äôre a world leader in recreational vehicles and boats, creating innovative ways to move on snow, water, asphalt, dirt and even in the air. Headquartered in the Canadian town of Valcourt, Quebec, our company is rooted in a spirit of ingenuity and intense customer focus. Today, we operate manufacturing facilities in Canada, the United States, Mexico, Finland, Australia and Austria, with a workforce made up of close to 23,000 spirited people, all driven by the deeply held belief that at work, as with life itself, it‚Äôs not about the destination; It‚Äôs about the journey. This position is based in Campinas, Brazil and is eligible to the BRP Employee Referral Program. You will have the opportunity to work in hybrid mode, 2 to 3 days in the office.

jobs_description: ADP Ventures is hiring a Lead Data Scientist. Does the thought of working with one of the most comprehensive employment data sets in the US excite you? Are you inspired by transformation and making an impact on the lives of millions of people every day? Well, this may be the role for you. Ready to design what is next? The ADP Ventures is a new business incubator, maturing ideas into new businesses and startups that will help our clients navigate the world of work. You will be working on a cross-functional team located in Porto Alegre, Brazil but with peers at our New York City office. As a member of the ASTRA team, you'll find that innovation is at the heart of everything we do. Embedded within the Ventures team, our mission is to leverage artificial intelligence to pioneer new pathways and solutions across a diverse range of products. With a commitment to excellence and a forward-thinking mindset, we are dedicated to pushing the boundaries of what is possible in AI, ensuring that we not only meet the needs of today but also anticipate and shape the future. Every day you will work on a global team with multiple stakeholders to identify, design, develop, and implement advanced analytics projects that assist our clients daily. You will work with your team to provide, interpret, and predict necessary metrics for decision-making. You will code with machine learning tools like Python, AWS, and ML (Machine Learning) techniques, to synthesize millions of data sets into patterns that answer ad hoc requests and generate valuable insights for our clients. Your work will focus on creating and refining state-of-the-art recommendation and conversation engines. Also, to research the latest developments in AI research and technology, actively incorporating new techniques and approaches to maintain our leadership in innovation. To thrive in this career, you should know how to identify errors and reactively fix them. You will need to have some formal education in quantitative analytics and know design patterns and data structures. You have the skills to leverage existing models or create new models using the technologies above. But given the scale of our data sets and the complex problems we give you to solve, you will stay challenged and engaged with years of exciting projects ahead‚Äîall while growing your skills and progressing in a rewarding career. Like what you see? Apply now! What You'll Do Learn more about ADP at tech.adp.com/careers Here is what you can expect on a typical day: Innovative Recommendation & Language Solutions. Your journey begins by leveraging your expertise in Recommendation Systems, Natural Language Processing (NLP), and Conversation Engines, enriched by your solid background in Advanced Analytics & Predictive Modeling. You'll confront complex challenges through adept analytical questioning, data extraction and analysis from varied sources, leading to the distillation of crucial insights. Advanced Analytics & Predictive Modeling. From the outset, your ability to synthesize insights into compelling narratives, complemented by visual representations and actionable recommendations, will be instrumental in pioneering innovative solutions in recommendation and language technologies. This expertise not only sets the foundation for success but also positions you as a key player in driving forward-thinking outcomes ‚Äîthis will set you up for success on Day 1. Own and Manage Projects. You will identify, design, develop, and implement advanced analytical projects. Limitless Possibilities. You will continue learning and discovering new ways to leverage ADP data to create new products and services and find more insights. You are passionate about learning and applying new techniques within data science that lead to innovations. Collaboration and Communication. You will be part of a collaborative team, listening to needs, then finding and sharing solutions. You are comfortable and skilled at presenting to both peers and leadership on your projects and findings. Experience. With at least 8 years of hands-on experience in Recommendation Engines, NLP, and/or Conversation Systems, you bring a wealth of knowledge and a track record of impactful contributions in similar roles. Your experience acts as a cornerstone for innovative problem-solving and thought leadership within our team. To Succeed In This Role Bachelor's degree in computer science, Statistics, Engineering, or a related field; Strong experience in relevant skills gained and developed in the same or similar role; Advanced English skills (able to interact daily with a distributed team); Fluency in Python - including popular data science packages (pandas, sklearn, etc) and quality tests; Strong knowledge of data structures, algorithms and methods used in the data science field; Experience with Machine Learning model development and deployment; Knowledge of Natural Language Processing and Conversation Engines; Experience with Recommendation systems; Knowledge with Cloud solutions (AWS, GCP, Azure); Interest in LLMs, Generative AI and Retrieval-augmented generation (RAG); Willing to work with ML Ops and Software Development activities as well. Bonus Points For These Master's degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Engineering, or a related field, with a strong focus on AI and Machine Learning; Good understanding of Software Engineering; Exposure to Jupyter notebooks and/or Databricks platform; Experience with AWS cloud solutions (S3, Glue, Lambda, SageMaker); Experience with integrating data products (recommender systems, classifiers, chatbots, etc) into applications in production environments; Knowledge of Continuous Integration & Delivery methodologies; Experience with Vector Databases. You'll Love Working Here Because You Can Have courageous team collaboration. Courage comes from how associates are willing to have difficult conversations, speak up, be an owner, and challenge one another's ideas to find the best solution. Deliver at epic scale. We deliver real user outcomes using strong judgment and good instincts. We are obsessed with the art of achieving simplicity with a focus on client happiness and productivity. Be surrounded by curious learners. We align ourselves with other smart people in an environment where we grow and elevate one another to the next level. We encourage our associates to listen, stay agile, and learn from their mistakes. Act like an owner & doer. Mission-driven and committed to leading change, you will be encouraged to take on any challenge and solve complex problems. No tasks are beneath or too great for us. We are hands-on and willing to master our craft. Give back to others. Always do the right thing for our clients and our community and humbly give back to the community where we live and work. Support our associates in times of need through ADP's Philanthropic Foundation. Join a company committed to equality and equity. Our goal is to impact lasting change through our actions. What are you waiting for? Apply today! Find out why people come to ADP and why they stay: https://youtu.be/ODb8lxBrxrY (ADA version: https://youtu.be/IQjUCA8SOoA ) Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Equal Employment Opportunity at ADP: ADP is committed to an inclusive, diverse and equitable workplace, and is further committed to providing equal employment opportunities regardless of any protected characteristic including: race, color, genetic information, creed, national origin, religion, sex, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, lawful alien status, ancestry, age, marital status, protected veteran status or disability. Hiring decisions are based upon ADP‚Äôs operating needs, and applicant merit including, but not limited to, qualifications, experience, ability, availability, cooperation, and job performance. Ethics at ADP: ADP has a long, proud history of conducting business with the highest ethical standards and full compliance with all applicable laws. We also expect our people to uphold our values with the highest level of integrity and behave in a manner that fosters an honest and respectful workplace. Click https://jobs.adp.com/life-at-adp/ to learn more about ADP‚Äôs culture and our full set of values.

jobs_description: About The Team Grocery is Uber's newest and fast growing business line, delighting customers with next-hour delivery of household essentials from their favorite local stores. The Grocery Fulfillment team is focused on building best-in-class products and technology to support consumers and shoppers in fulfilling grocery orders. The Grocery Fulfillment team is looking for a strong engineering leader to execute on the team's ambitious and fast-paced product strategy. This is a very important and visible role with a potential for significant impact on the fast growing grocery business. The EM will lead a product focused team in close collaboration with product and data science leads to build shopping tools that power the grocery business. For an engineering manager with strong execution muscle, technical depth and product sense, this will be an excellent opportunity to learn, succeed and grow at Uber. About The Role As an Engineering Manager at Uber, you will be leading a group of engineers working with product managers, data scientists and other engineering teams to build solutions globally. We are looking for an Engineering Manager for the Uber Grocery team who will be responsible to build, mentor and manage a strong and high-impact team to offer an oustant and instant delivery for our partners! What You'll Do Directly own an engineering team passionate about learning and iterating with velocity. Challenge engineers to design innovative, highly-scalable, and robust systems. Build trust and foster a collaborative team culture. Build a strong brand and be able to attract and retain talent. Strategize and influence the product vision and roadmap in collaboration with the product and business team. Mentor other engineers and build a strong culture of quality, handle conflicts well and help build consensus. What You'll Need Bachelor's degree or higher in an engineering field (e.g. Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Technology etc.). A strong ability to architect and design robust, high-scale systems and to challenge engineers to think bigger and more generically in developing their solutions. Experience working with multi-functional, globally distributed teams to coordinate work and deliver solutions that span multiple teams. Collaboration with PMs, designers, data scientists and infrastructure teams to identify, prioritize and solve problems. Working actively on career mentor & development, handle performance & conflicts, influence cross-functional teams. Track record of managing, recruiting, and retaining strong engineering talent and growing effective teams. Desire knowledge about large-scale, distributed systems, including SQL/NoSQL storage, transactional updates, asynchronous processing with message queues like Kafka, logging, system monitoring, and performance tuning.

jobs_description: Job Description Data and Documentation Control Administrators At Nextracker, we are leading in the energy transition, providing the most comprehensive portfolio of intelligent solar tracker and control software solutions for solar power plants, as well as strategic services to capture the full value of solar power plants for our customers. Our talented worldwide teams are transforming PV plant performance every day with smart technology, data monitoring and analysis services. As a company driving the clean energy transition, sustainability is not just a word. It's a core part of our business and our operations. Our sustainability efforts are based on five cornerstones: People, Community, Environment, Innovation, and Integrity. We are creative, collaborative and passionate problem-solvers from diverse backgrounds, driven by our shared mission to provide smart solar and software solutions for our customers and to mitigate climate change for future generations. Make your mark with Nextracker. Job Description: Manage data integrity, security and access in our PLM system including issuing item numbers for product/documentation, item creation, change requests, change orders creation, reporting, attribute maintenance, active item list and end of life maintenance, integration and data extracts, supporting automation initiatives and support data integrity into downstream tools. We Are Looking For Someone Who Demonstrates Intense collaboration Passionate customer focus Thoughtful, fast, disciplined execution Tenacious commitment to continuous improvement Relentless drive to win Duties Include And Not Limited To Data integrity and security, and accurate maintenance of product lifecycle data in our Engineering and management tools. Accurate item record creation including consistent naming convention, data fields selections, change order creation including consistent summary and description, linking relevant processes to the items or changes. Data entry into database, including creation of requests and change orders per company approval and tracking process. Also includes tasks such as reports, testing and subsequent write ups, and mass database updates via CSV upload Special projects such as problem solving and improving processes. Skills Required Critical thinker: able to sort out complex problems and voice potential solutions Team player: able to work with a varied team and other departments, get along with others; also must be able to both work independently or take direction as the situation calls for it Experience with Solidworks and other design drafting tools, with ability to follow best practices and good standards as it pertains to maintaining relevant data on the document or drawing and uploading files into database. Experienced with Product Lifecycle Management systems, bonus if experienced with tools such as Arena, NetSuite, Salesforce Minimum 2 years of database maintenance experience, or equivalent university program experience may be considered. At Nextracker, we are leading in the energy transition, providing the most comprehensive portfolio of intelligent solar tracker and software solutions for solar power plants, as well as strategic services to capture the full value of solar power plants for our customers. Our talented worldwide teams are transforming PV plant performance every day with smart technology, data monitoring and analysis services. For us at Nextracker, sustainability is not just a word. It's a core part of our business, values and our operations. Our sustainability efforts are based on five cornerstones: People, Community, Environment, Innovation, and Integrity. We are creative, collaborative and passionate problem-solvers from diverse backgrounds, driven by our shared mission to provide smart solar and software solutions for our customers and to mitigate climate change for future generations. Culture is our Passion

jobs_description: Bigtrade, an agricultural fintech, uses technology to streamline credit access for rural producers. We seek individuals eager to contribute in a dynamic, collaborative environment. We're seeking a Software Engineer with a knack for advanced mathematics and machine learning, excited about pioneering innovative solutions in a startup setting. If you enjoy building new things and tackling challenges, this could be your ideal opportunity. As a Software Engineer for applied Machine Learning, you'll collaborate on researching and developing strategies for computer vision and agriculture tech. You'll implement intelligent decisions from diverse data sources, suggest new integrations, and improve existing solutions. What You'll Do: Translate business problems into mathematical challenges. Collaborate with a team to collect and analyze data. Contribute ideas for data-driven solutions in brainstorming sessions. Design, develop, and deploy machine learning models. Build and maintain automation pipelines. Define KPIs for evaluating model performance. Critically evaluate and enhance implemented solutions. Requirements: Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Proficiency in verbal and written English communication. Ability to interpret and make decisions based on data. Autonomous learning ability and teamwork skills. Proficiency in data mining and machine learning techniques. Experience with TensorFlow, Keras, or PyTorch. Understanding of computer science fundamentals. Skills in data processing using SQL and Spark. Experience with version control systems like GitHub. Background in advanced mathematics, including probability theory and statistics. Nice to Have: Previous experience in computer vision or agronomics. Familiarity with container technologies like Docker and AWS ECR. Knowledge of the AWS ecosystem. Understanding of DevOps principles. Experience with data visualization tools. Seniority Level: This role requires senior expertise , particularly in executing complex machine learning projects. Interested in learning more about the company and the position? qtd_candidatos: Seja uma das primeiras pessoas a se candidatar
jobs_description: Join Puffy's team at our Dubai headquarters situated in the world's safest and most globally connected city. Puffy is a rapidly expanding e-commerce retailer renowned for our exceptional mattresses loved by millions of sleepers in North America. Since entering the bed-in-a-box market in 2016, we've achieved consistent year-on-year growth and garnered attention from top publications like Entrepreneur.com and TechCompanyNews. Our product line now includes a complete range of bedroom essentials, from pillows to bedding and accessories. The AI Innovation Specialist will be at the forefront of driving AI adoption and innovation across the organization. This role will proactively identify, evaluate, and implement AI tools and platforms that enhance the efficiency, effectiveness, and profitability of our business processes. The successful candidate will be passionate about AI, possess a deep understanding of the latest advancements, and continuously challenge the organization to accelerate AI adoption. Key Accountabilities: AI Tool Identification and Evaluation Proactively scan the market to identify emerging AI tools and platforms that have the potential to improve our business efficiency, effectiveness, and profitability Conduct comprehensive reviews of identified tools to assess their capabilities against our existing tools and determine their potential to drive business value Stay up-to-date with the latest AI advancements and industry trends to keep our organization at the forefront of AI innovation Business Case Development and Approval Collaborate with process owners to develop concise briefs and associated business cases for the adoption of new AI tools Present business cases to senior management, highlighting the potential benefits, costs, and risks associated with each tool Secure necessary approvals and funding for the implementation of selected AI tools AI Tool Implementation and Handover Own the end-to-end implementation process for approved AI tools, facilitating seamless integration with existing systems and processes Work closely with relevant stakeholders to achieve successful deployment, training, and user adoption, enabling a smooth handover to BAU teams Monitor and track the implementation progress, addressing any issues or roadblocks promptly Post-Implementation Review and Value Assessment Conduct thorough post-implementation reviews to evaluate the impact and effectiveness of implemented AI tools Analyze key metrics and gather feedback from users to assess the value for money and ROI of each tool Identify areas for improvement and make recommendations for optimizing the use of AI tools across the organization AI Awareness and Capability Building Act as an AI evangelist, driving awareness and enthusiasm for AI adoption across the organization Develop and deliver training sessions and communication materials to educate employees about AI best practices Required Skills & Experience: Expertise in AI and machine learning technologies, with a proven track record of applying these to drive business value. Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills, with a knack for creative solution-finding. Strong leadership and communication abilities, capable of inspiring change and engaging with senior management. A proactive, self-starter attitude, driven by a desire to innovate and challenge the conventional. Demonstrated experience in project management and stakeholder engagement, with a focus on delivering measurable outcomes. Why joining us could be the next best step in your career? Fast Hire: Land the job in just 2 weeks. Top Pay & Bonuses: Competitive salary with a 10% monthly bonus. Career Growth: Fast-tracked career progression. Work with the Best: Join our Forbes-recognized CEO and a team that‚Äôs driving the sleep industry forward. Perks Galore: From health benefits to office lunches every Friday, we‚Äôve got it all. Simple Process: Just click, apply, and take an online test to get started! What‚Äôs next? Click ‚ÄúApply‚Äù to start your application today! We've optimized our recruitment process into 3 simple steps. We want to ensure that all applicants have a fair and equal chance, so we use our Phase 1 online assessment. This minimizes unconscious bias in our hiring process. Successful candidates will be invited to Phase 2 within one business day of the successful completion of Phase 1.

titulo: Machine Learning Engineer - Focus in NLP/Generative AI
jobs_description: ADP is hiring a Data Scientist. Does the thought of working with one of the most comprehensive employment data sets excite you? Are you inspired by transformation and making an impact on the lives of millions of people every day? Well, this may be the role for you. Ready to design what's next? In this role, you'll acquire, clean, and analyze large data sets and do exploratory analysis to understand our data and if it meets project requirements. It's more than digits and dials - you're making huge decisions that impact millions of customers. Every day you'll work with multiple stakeholders to identify, design, develop and implement advanced analytics projects that track the consumer conversion funnel from start to end. You'll work with your team to provide, interpret, and predict necessary metrics for decision-making. You'll train state-of-the-art deep learning models on quite exciting databases using tools like Python and AWS. To thrive in this career, you should know how to identify errors and reactively fix them. You'll need to have some formal education in quantitative analytics and know design patterns and data structures. You have the skills to leverage existing models or create new models using the technologies above. But given the scale of our data sets and the complex problems we give you to solve, you will stay challenged and engaged with years of exciting projects ahead--all while growing your skills and progressing in a rewarding career. Like what you see? Apply now! Learn More About ADP At Tech.adp.com/careers A little about ADP: We are a global leader in HR technology, offering the latest AI and machine learning-enhanced payroll, tax, HR, benefits, and much more. We believe our people make all the difference in cultivating an inclusive, down-to-earth culture that welcomes ideas, encourages innovation, and values belonging. ADP has a deep commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion as a global Best Places to Work, DiversityInc¬Æ Top 50 Company, Best CEO and company for women, LGBTQ+, multicultural talent, and more. Learn more about ADP's commitment on our YouTube channel: http://adp.careers/DEI_Videos What You'll Do Here's what you can expect on a typical day: Advanced Analytics & Predictive Modeling. You bring prior experience to the role of formulating analytical problems, extracting & analyzing data from multiple systems, summarizing critical findings/insights, and developing a compelling visual representation of analyses with actionable recommendations--this will set you up for success on Day 1. Own and Manage Projects. You will identify, design, develop, and implement advanced analytical projects. Limitless Possibilities. You will continue learning and discovering new ways to leverage ADP data to create new products and services and find more insights. You are passionate about learning and applying new techniques within data science that leads to innovations. Collaboration and Communication. You'll be part of a collaborative team, listening to needs, then finding and sharing solutions. You're comfortable and skilled at presenting to both peers and leadership on your projects and findings. To Succeed In This Role You have 2-5 years of experience in relevant skills gained and developed in the same or similar role. You'll have a Bachelor's degree OR equivalent. Prior experience with Machine Learning, Python, Natural Language Processing, Deep Learning, AWS; data integration tools like Databricks will give you extra comfort in this role to be successful. You'll Love Working Here Because You Can Have courageous team collaboration. Courage comes from how associates are willing to have difficult conversations, speak up, be an owner, and challenge one another's ideas to find the best solution. Deliver at epic scale. We deliver real user outcomes using strong judgment and good instincts. We're obsessed with the art of achieving simplicity with a focus on client happiness and productivity. Be surrounded by curious learners. We align ourselves with other smart people in an environment where we grow and elevate one another to the next level. We encourage our associates to listen, stay agile, and learn from mistakes. Act like an owner & doer. Mission-driven and committed to leading change, you will be encouraged to take on any challenge and solve complex problems. No tasks are beneath or too great for us. We are hands-on and willing to master our craft. Give back to others. Always do the right thing for our clients and our community and humbly give back to the community where we live and work. Support our associates in times of need through ADP's Philanthropic Foundation. Join a company committed to equality and equity. Our goal is to impact lasting change through our actions. What are you waiting for? Apply today! Find out why people come to ADP and why they stay: https://youtu.be/ODb8lxBrxrY (ADA version: https://youtu.be/IQjUCA8SOoA) Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Equal Employment Opportunity at ADP: ADP is committed to an inclusive, diverse and equitable workplace, and is further committed to providing equal employment opportunities regardless of any protected characteristic including: race, color, genetic information, creed, national origin, religion, sex, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, lawful alien status, ancestry, age, marital status, protected veteran status or disability. Hiring decisions are based upon ADP‚Äôs operating needs, and applicant merit including, but not limited to, qualifications, experience, ability, availability, cooperation, and job performance. Ethics at ADP: ADP has a long, proud history of conducting business with the highest ethical standards and full compliance with all applicable laws. We also expect our people to uphold our values with the highest level of integrity and behave in a manner that fosters an honest and respectful workplace. Click https://jobs.adp.com/life-at-adp/ to learn more about ADP‚Äôs culture and our full set of values.

jobs_description: 689675BR Introduction At IBM, our work is more than a job, it's a calling: To build. To design. To code. To consult. To think together with our customers and sell. Create markets. We're looking for passionate, original thinkers who want to drive progress, grow their network and further their careers. If you see yourself as someone who never stops learning, who believes no problem is too big to solve, and who wants to unleash your potential, IBM services is for you. About Business Unit IBM Consulting is IBM‚Äôs consulting and global professional services business, with market leading capabilities in business and technology transformation. Your Life @ IBM In a world where technology never stands still, we understand that, dedication to our clients success, innovation that matters, and trust and personal responsibility in all our relationships, lives in what we do as IBMers as we strive to be the catalyst that makes the world work better. Being an IBMer means you‚Äôll be able to learn and develop yourself and your career, you‚Äôll be encouraged to be courageous and experiment everyday, all whilst having continuous trust and support in an environment where everyone can thrive whatever their personal or professional background. Our IBMers are growth minded, always staying curious, open to feedback and learning new information and skills to constantly transform themselves and our company. They are trusted to provide on-going feedback to help other IBMers grow, as well as collaborate with colleagues keeping in mind a team focused approach to include different perspectives to drive exceptional outcomes for our customers. The courage our IBMers have to make critical decisions everyday is essential to IBM becoming the catalyst for progress, always embracing challenges with resources they have to hand, a can-do attitude and always striving for an outcome focused approach within everything that they do. Are you ready to be an IBMer? About IBM IBM‚Äôs greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that through the application of intelligence, reason and science, we can improve business, society and the human condition, bringing the power of an open hybrid cloud and AI strategy to life for our clients and partners around the world.Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are not only one of the largest corporate organizations in the world, we‚Äôre also one of the biggest technology and consulting employers, with many of the Fortune 50 companies relying on the IBM Cloud to run their business. Location: Curitiba, Parana Company: Wiley (CLT Position) Our mission is to unlock human potential. Bring your experiences, your perspectives, and your passion; it‚Äôs in our differences that we empower the way the world learns. About the Role: This position within the Wiley Data Analytics & Insights team, is responsible for functioning as the Data Engineer, to develop and maintain data pipelines from multiple data sources into our Data Lake environment. This individual will work very closely with the other development leads, data engineers, and data architects to build and maintain data pipelines going to different zones of the Snowflake Data Warehouse environment. Determine the optimal approach for extracting, transforming, and loading data into different zones of Data Lake (Raw/Native, Processed/Transformed, Enriched, Archive). This includes design and development to prepare data for movement storage & consumption Views, ELT Processes, Extracts & other processes that manipulate, aggregate, clean, or enrich the data. The individual should demonstrate a thorough understanding of business validations and data quality. They should apply these principles diligently within our processes, aligning with the specific use cases. This data lake would see regular addition of datasets from internal and external sources deemed important for Wiley‚Äôs data analytics and insights requirements. In some cases, this role may involve building repeatable data feeds to and from platforms such as, Salesforce, SAP, MDM, Eloqua, e-commerce websites, etc. The position requires development skills to enable the matching and linking of internal and external data sources (especially as it relates to Customer and products) using analytical techniques/tools. The role will have frequent interaction/collaboration with Solutions Architects, Data Architects, BI & Analytics Development, Data Engineering, Marketing, Sales, Application/Product teams and Enterprise Architects to support Wiley‚Äôs Data Analytics and Insights roadmap. How you will make an impact: Design and implement secure data pipelines into a Snowflake data warehouse from on-premise and cloud data sources Define best practices and standards for data pipelining and integration with Snowflake data lake and warehouses in collaboration with Data Architect and other Data leads Design and implement high-performing data pipelines feeding downstream systems Collaborate with onshore/ offshore data engineers, BA, and Scrum Masters who will be building or testing data applications in Snowflake environment. Design and implement high-performing BI dashboard integrations Cognos and QlikView working with reporting and data visualization developers Ensure enterprise security and access control policies are adhered to in the solution Creation of architecture and design artifacts and documents Conduct design and code reviews What we look for: B.S Computer Science or related degree 4+ years experience in data pipeline architecture and data modelling Demonstrably deep understanding of SQL and relational databases (Snowflake preferred) Experience with Snowflake SnowSQL and writing user-defined functions would be a plus Hands-on experience with Python, Scala, Java, SQL, and tools like NIFI, Attunity, Spark (Databricks/Qubole), etc. Hands-on experience with data pipeline tools within cloud-based environments (Argo, Airflow, Luigi, DBT) Hands-on experience with CI/CD tools and practices (CircleCI, Travis, Jenkins) Hands-on experience with AWS (SQS, S3, Kinesys, Firehose, MKS, Lambda) Experience with open-source data warehouse tools Constantly improve product quality, security, and performance Write good code, performant code (Python preferred) About Wiley: Wiley is a trusted leader in research and learning, our pioneering solutions and services are paving the way for knowledge seekers as they work to solve the world‚Äôs most important challenges. We are advocates of advancement, empowering knowledge-seekers to transform today‚Äôs biggest obstacles into tomorrow‚Äôs brightest opportunities. With over 200 years of experience in publishing, we continue to evolve knowledge seekers‚Äô steps into strides, illuminating their path forward to personal, educational, and professional success at every stage. Around the globe, we break down barriers for innovators, empowering them to advance discoveries in their fields, adapt their workforces, and shape minds. When applying, please attach your resume/CV to be considered
