We Are Looking For Someone Who Demonstrates Intense collaboration Passionate customer focus Thoughtful, fast, disciplined execution Tenacious commitment to continuous improvement Relentless drive to win Duties Include And Not Limited To Data integrity and security, and accurate maintenance of product lifecycle data in our Engineering and management tools. Accurate item record creation including consistent naming convention, data fields selections, change order creation including consistent summary and description, linking relevant processes to the items or changes. Data entry into database, including creation of requests and change orders per company approval and tracking process. Also includes tasks such as reports, testing and subsequent write ups, and mass database updates via CSV upload Special projects such as problem solving and improving processes. Skills Required Critical thinker: able to sort out complex problems and voice potential solutions Team player: able to work with a varied team and other departments, get along with others; also must be able to both work independently or take direction as the situation calls for it Experience with Solidworks and other design drafting tools, with ability to follow best practices and good standards as it pertains to maintaining relevant data on the document or drawing and uploading files into database. Experienced with Product Lifecycle Management systems, bonus if experienced with tools such as Arena, NetSuite, Salesforce Minimum 2 years of database maintenance experience, or equivalent university program experience may be considered. At Nextracker, we are leading in the energy transition, providing the most comprehensive portfolio of intelligent solar tracker and software solutions for solar power plants, as well as strategic services to capture the full value of solar power plants for our customers. Our talented worldwide teams are transforming PV plant performance every day with smart technology, data monitoring and analysis services. For us at Nextracker, sustainability is not just a word. It's a core part of our business, values and our operations. Our sustainability efforts are based on five cornerstones: People, Community, Environment, Innovation, and Integrity. We are creative, collaborative and passionate problem-solvers from diverse backgrounds, driven by our shared mission to provide smart solar and software solutions for our customers and to mitigate climate change for future generations. Culture is our Passion

titulo: Exclusive PWD - IBM Brazil Internship Program - Associates
jobs_description: 689675BR Introduction At IBM, our work is more than a job, it's a calling: To build. To design. To code. To consult. To think together with our customers and sell. Create markets. Invent. To collaborate. Not only to do things in a better way, but to reach for the impossible. Are you passionate about being at the forefront of the new era in technology and solve some of the world's most challenging problems? If so, Blue Journey, IBM's internship program, is the place for you. Blue Journey aims to promote the professional development of students through practical experiences, contact with a global community of more than 6000 interns and free learning tools, offering a workplace experience that promotes diversity and inclusion, to gain new skills and become qualified, differentiated professionals who are essential for society. Be part of a real company project, train and develop in a global company. If you are currently studying a STEM career, you have a passion for technology and innovation and you meet the requirements APPLY NOW! Your Role and Responsibilities Affirmative Position For People With Disabilities. Unleash your potential - for our clients and your career Joining IBM Services as an Associate offers you an opportunity to work on client teams, using technologies to help business transform the way they work. As an Associate, you'll develop relevant skills and quickly gain meaningful experience. Your network of experts and mentors will provide career coaching and experience with leading technology, while you solve clients' most challenging problems with future-defining solutions. Consultant You are a great thinker - and you are passionate about making change. Develop these great ideas for customer and help define how companies interact with the world. Combine your expertise and your business and technical interests to help transform global companies. Data Scientist You understand that a business strategy is data driven. After all, a cognitive business is a thinking business. Analyze data and forecast trends to make relevant recommendations to customers, using cognitive tools to research and analyze data. Designer By providing guidance, you are building on your experience. Understanding the user is an art (combined with a lot of research), and you never tire of making interactions. As an Associate Designer for IBM customers, you will focus on customer needs and creating world-class digital experiences. Developer When you create and perform interactions, you solve problems, whether it's just fixing a bug or creating an application that changes the way how we live. Take on variety of activities: high-performance design, development and maintenance, and scalability of databases and server applications. Technical Specialist You are not scared of complex scenarios. You are innovative and want to make a difference using technology. jobs_description: About The Team Grocery is Uber's newest and fast growing business line, delighting customers with next-hour delivery of household essentials from their favorite local stores. The Grocery Fulfillment team is focused on building best-in-class products and technology to support consumers and shoppers in fulfilling grocery orders. The Grocery Fulfillment team is looking for a strong engineering leader to execute on the team's ambitious and fast-paced product strategy. This is a very important and visible role with a potential for significant impact on the fast growing grocery business. The EM will lead a product focused team in close collaboration with product and data science leads to build shopping tools that power the grocery business. For an engineering manager with strong execution muscle, technical depth and product sense, this will be an excellent opportunity to learn, succeed and grow at Uber. About The Role As an Engineering Manager at Uber, you will be leading a group of engineers working with product managers, data scientists and other engineering teams to build solutions globally. We are looking for an Engineering Manager for the Uber Grocery team who will be responsible to build, mentor and manage a strong and high-impact team to offer an oustant and instant delivery for our partners! What You'll Do Directly own an engineering team passionate about learning and iterating with velocity. Challenge engineers to design innovative, highly-scalable, and robust systems. Build trust and foster a collaborative team culture. Build a strong brand and be able to attract and retain talent. Strategize and influence the product vision and roadmap in collaboration with the product and business team. Mentor other engineers and build a strong culture of quality, handle conflicts well and help build consensus. What You'll Need Bachelor's degree or higher in an engineering field (e.g. Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Technology etc.). A strong ability to architect and design robust, high-scale systems and to challenge engineers to think bigger and more generically in developing their solutions. Experience working with multi-functional, globally distributed teams to coordinate work and deliver solutions that span multiple teams. Collaboration with PMs, designers, data scientists and infrastructure teams to identify, prioritize and solve problems. Working actively on career mentor & development, handle performance & conflicts, influence cross-functional teams. Track record of managing, recruiting, and retaining strong engineering talent and growing effective teams. Desire knowledge about large-scale, distributed systems, including SQL/NoSQL storage, transactional updates, asynchronous processing with message queues like Kafka, logging, system monitoring, and performance tuning.

jobs_description: DESCRIPTION At Amazon, we are working to be the most customer-centric company on earth. The Amazon Student Programs Team is looking for students to join Amazon as Business Analyst Intern. As a business analyst intern you will be trained in one of our business intelligence, retail, or seller services teams. The internship provides an opportunity to learn and understand Amazon business processes, enhance analytical skills, and contribute to make significant business impact. As an intern, you will be matched to a manager and a mentor. In addition to learning about an impactful project, you will have the opportunity to engage with Amazonians for both personal and professional development, expand your network, and participate in activities with other interns throughout your internship. No matter the location of your internship, we give you the tools to own your project and learn in a real-world setting. Amazon adopts a hybrid work model and all employees, including interns, are required to work from the office 3x per week. Amazon headquarter is based in S√£o Paulo ‚Äì SP. jobs_description: Please submit your resume in English - we can only consider applications submitted in this language. Minimum qualifications: Bachelor‚Äôs degree or equivalent practical experience. 2 years of experience with software development in one or more programming languages, or 1 year of experience with an advanced degree in an industry setting. 2 years of experience with data structures or algorithms in either an academic or industry setting. Ability to communicate in English fluently as this is a customer-facing role that requires interactions in English with local stakeholders. Preferred qualifications: Master's degree or PhD in Computer Science or related technical fields. 2 years of experience with performance, large-scale systems data analysis, visualization tools, and/or debugging. Experience developing accessible technologies. Proficiency in code and system health, diagnosis and resolution, and software test engineering. About The Job Google's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how billions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. Our products need to handle information at massive scale, and extend well beyond web search. We're looking for engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, UI design and mobile; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software engineer, you will work on a specific project critical to Google‚Äôs needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects as you and our fast-paced business grow and evolve. We need our engineers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to take on new problems across the full-stack as we continue to push technology forward. The Pipeline Infrastructure team is responsible for combining the technology for pipelines that generate signals for Search. The team develops, maintains, and optimizes the infrastructure to reliably generate SQ signals for ranking from data processing, covering all steps from processing logs/qlogs, data logic and integration API, verification, validation, and pushing to production. The team is also responsible for optimizing the pipelines and interfacing with clients of generated signals. In this role, you will work with the challenge of improving the most relevant Search pipelines, which need to be efficient and attend clients requirements. Use your creativity and expertise on projects that re-architect the pipelines at Search. In Google Search, we're reimagining what it means to search for information ‚Äì any way and anywhere. To do that, we need to solve complex engineering challenges and expand our infrastructure, while maintaining a universally accessible and useful experience that people around the world rely on. In joining the Search team, you'll have an opportunity to make an impact on billions of people globally. Responsibilities Process and generate data, considering the limits of the framework, storage, and efficiency. Plan for organic growth. Follow policies and regulations compliance. Utilize experimentation infrastructure. Monitor pipeline reliability. Detect and address outages and problems are critical components of the pipeline. Ensure pipeline validation and refresh. Automate pipeline. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .

jobs_description: About The Role We are seeking an experienced Data Analyst to join our team and work for the Sandbox Group - Remote. The ideal candidate will be responsible for collecting, analyzing, and interpreting large sets of data to support business decisions. You will work closely with stakeholders to understand their data requirements, design and implement data collection processes, and produce insights that drive business growth. What you will be doing: Collect, analyze, and interpret large data sets to identify trends, patterns, and relationships Work closely with stakeholders to understand their data requirements and design and implement data collection processes to meet those needs Build and maintain data dashboards and reports to provide stakeholders with real-time insights into business performance Develop and implement statistical models to support decision-making and predict future trends Communicate insights and recommendations to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner, using visualizations and other data presentation techniques Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify areas for improvement and drive data-driven decision making across the organization What you¬¥ll need to succeed in this role: 6 years of experience in a data analyst role, with a strong track record of delivering high-quality data-driven insights Experience with programming languages (Python is preferred) Experience with data orchestration tools (e.g., Apache Airflow) Proficiency in data visualization tools (e.g. Data Studio, Looker, Metabase) Knowledge of statistical analysis and modeling techniques (e.g. regression, hypothesis testing) Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to present complex data insights to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner Strong problem-solving and critical thinking skills, with the ability to identify and analyze complex data patterns and relationships Qualifications Bachelor's or Master's degree in a relevant field (e.g. Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics) Strong SQL skills, with the ability to write complex queries to extract and manipulate data .Strong proficiency in data modeling, ETL development, and data warehousing Differentials: Data Engineering skills will be a plus Why choose SandBox Engage. Entertain. Educate. Sandbox Group is set to redefine learning through its portfolio of award-winning digital & physical products and services for kids, parents, and teachers. The business is focused on bringing families and educators the best experiences in a safe and fun environment, and hopes to create a world where everyone is empowered to learn! The team at Sandbox understands the time, discipline, and expertise needed to develop brilliant learning experiences. Over the next few years, their aim is to reach more kids, parents, and teachers across the world. They intend to build and diversify their current offering by bringing additional products and services into the Sandbox family, covering the core audiences; Pre-K, K-8 Kids, Parents, and Teachers. At our company, we firmly believe that diversity is the key to success. We are dedicated to fostering an inclusive atmosphere and actively seeking team members from a wide range of professional and cultural backgrounds. If you're eager to take on your next significant career opportunity, we eagerly await your application. Powered by JazzHR YdsHT4GAAL

qtd_candidatos: Seja uma das primeiras pessoas a se candidatar
jobs_description: Who We Are At Fortis Games we aspire to make great games that bring people together while redefining how game companies work. We believe in building a sense of belonging through our games, their communities, and how we operate and treat each other. Through our game communities, we will create powerful connections and lasting memories. We will foster a culture of diversity, equity and belonging where together our diverse skills, experiences and backgrounds impact the games we make. We are an early but mighty organization with a leadership team of game industry veterans. There are many opportunities for you to have a big impact on the products we'll be making as well as the overall direction of the company. If you're passionate about tackling difficult problems with direct and thoughtful communication and team first mentality, we may be the right place for you. About The Role Join our dynamic and newly founded Analytics team as a Senior Game Analyst, where you'll play a pivotal role in shaping the future of game analytics at Fortis. Your expertise will be key in defining best practices, establishing new methodologies, and identifying valuable insights that will drive our games to new heights. As a trusted analytics partner to our games teams, your impactful analyses will influence game development from Soft Launch to Worldwide Launch. Collaborating with the wider data department, you'll tackle complex analytics challenges, contributing to ingenious solutions that enhance our team's efficiency. If you're a passionate analyst who thrives on immersing yourself in game design and details while continuously honing your skills to deliver exceptional value, this role is tailor-made for you. Join us in creating the foundation of a top-notch game analytics function and be a driving force behind the success of our captivating games. What You‚Äôll Achieve Analyze large, complex data sets representing the behavior of players to address strategic and operational questions Work with all organization from engineering to marketing, to improve the performance of teams‚Äô initiatives Develop frameworks, models, and tools to ensure data is accessible and influences decisions at all levels Provide actionable recommendations and conclusions using analytics to iterate on game design, features, economies, and product roadmaps Present your findings in a comprehensive way to audiences, from technical to non-technical audiences. What You‚Äôll Need To Be Successful Previous experience in game analytics or analytics in social tech, games, mobile or consumer web applications Advanced statistical analysis, data mining, and predictive modeling techniques knowledge Expert in SQL and comfort querying large and complex datasets Expert of Python/R Experience with Looker is a plus Strong Experience with Telemetry: design analytics events, coordinate implementation and QA Ability to manage multiple projects at the same time and prioritize tasks autonomously Excellent English communication skills, written and oral Passionate about Analytics and staying up-to-date Experience with mentoring more junior analysts Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, or a related field is a plus. Master's degree preferred. Why join us There are many reasons to join us, but here are a few: We strongly believe we are changing how games studios operate and at the core of what we do is making great games that create a connected community We're not just about making Games Where You Belong. We're also about building communities where our people belong. That's why Fortis is a thriving environment that celebrates diversity, embraces inclusivity, and fosters growth. Build and grow with a seasoned team of accomplished talent who have left an impactful mark in their disciplines, both in and out of gaming Fortis is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable law, and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

jobs_description: Please submit your resume in English - we can only consider applications submitted in this language. Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following: Belo Horizonte, State of Minas Gerais, Brazil; S√£o Paulo, State of S√£o Paulo, Brazil . Minimum qualifications: Bachelor‚Äôs degree or equivalent practical experience. 2 years of experience with software development in one or more programming languages (e.g. C++ or Java), or 1 year of experience with an advanced degree in an industry setting. 2 years of experience with data structures or algorithms in either an academic or industry setting, and experience developing infrastructure, distributed systems or networks, or experience with compute technologies, storage, or hardware architecture. Ability to communicate in English fluently to support client relationship management in this region. Preferred qualifications: Master's degree or PhD in Computer Science or related technical fields. Experience with large-scale distributed systems. Experience with API design, implementation and integration, and ability to make short-term/long-term decisions. Experience with quality analysis and iteration, including metrics development and analysis, good reporting and data summarization skills. Knowledge of modern Machine Learning (ML) techniques, including Natural Language Processing (NLP). About The Job Google's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how billions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. Our products need to handle information at massive scale, and extend well beyond web search. We're looking for engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, UI design and mobile; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software engineer, you will work on a specific project critical to Google‚Äôs needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects as you and our fast-paced business grow and evolve. We need our engineers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to take on new problems across the full-stack as we continue to push technology forward. Search Developer Platform (SDP) is part of the larger Search organization with the mission of accelerating the efficient development of compelling and innovative Search experiences. Scalability, developer velocity, and advancing quality goals of Search are the cornerstones of our work. We bring an AI-first focus to the evolution of Search infrastructure, in a close partnership with other teams in Search and across Google. In Google Search, we're reimagining what it means to search for information ‚Äì any way and anywhere. To do that, we need to solve complex engineering challenges and expand our infrastructure, while maintaining a universally accessible and useful experience that people around the world rely on. In joining the Search team, you'll have an opportunity to make an impact on billions of people globally. Responsibilities Execute independently on complex software development tasks, under the supervision of a tech lead. Make substantial improvements to existing systems or create new systems, planning out and independently executing work over multiple weeks‚Äô time. Optimize Search latency for core web search systems. Contribute directly to Search growth by providing a faster experience for our users. Build machine learning models and tune existing ones to more efficiently serve Search features and results to users. Improve, adapt, and extend core Search result generation systems. Deepen our understanding of search behaviors and user information needs through logs analysis and model building to improve result quality and latency, delighting users. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .

As an intern, selected candidate(s) will be matched to a manager and a mentor, and will have the opportunity to have an impact on the evolution of Amazon technology and help with critical business projects early in their careers. Our team of interns' design, code, and raw smarts will contribute to solving complex technical challenges in the areas of distributed systems, data mining, automation, optimization, scalability, and security. Software Development Engineering internships at Amazon are based on writing software code and collaborating with a team of tenured Software Development Engineers (SDEs) who guide project deliverables that matter to our customers. jobs_description: Are you experienced with digital marketing tracking platforms such as Google Ads, Google Analytics, Microsoft Ads, Meta, and TikTok ? Can you confidently navigate these platforms and implement thorough conversion tracking ? Are you skilled in backend operations of websites like Shopify, Magento, and BigCommerce, with the ability to effectively communicate technical concepts in a simple manner ? If you answered YES to all of these questions, we are ready for you to join us! We are looking for a Web Analytics Specialist to join our growing team! Your mission at Algofy : will be to collaborate with our team to implement, debug , and QA tracking setups across various ad platforms and websites. You'll work closely with team leads of the website and .com (Search and Social) departments, along with our internal data associate , to ensure seamless tracking alignment and optimization. Your daily responsibilities will be: Deploying & validating conversion setup across GTM, web and ad platforms for new clients Monitoring QA and debug tracking implementation for current clients Working with the .com and web team to ensure tracking implementation matches ad strategy Managing onboarding new clients and ensuring we have access to all needed platforms Setting up CRO tests using a visual or hard code editor Required Skills And Qualifications: Experience in digital marketing tracking platforms (Google Ads, Google Analytics, Microsoft Ads, Meta, TikTok) at the level where you are capable of navigating the platforms and implementing thorough conversion tracking Ability to create custom and complex variables through Javascript Proficiency in English at a high level (C2 proficiency) with excellent written English and proofreading abilities Proficiency in backend operations of websites such as Shopify, Magento, and BigCommerce Ability to effectively communicate technical concepts and solutions in a simple manner Comfortable with having meetings with onboarding clients Proficient in Google Sheets for data management and analysis Proficient in Regular Expressions (RegEx) for Google Tag Manager (GTM) and Google Analytics Google Tag Manager (GTM) experience integrations: variables, events, custom IDs, S2S (server-to-server) Strong understanding of GA4 implementation and best practices Knowledgeable on iOS 14 and cookieless technology Nice to have: Experience with HTML, CSS, and Javascript at a level where you are able to optimize UX experiences on client pages Technically savvy with experience in Content Management Systems (CMS) like Shopify, BigCommerce, or similar platforms Skilled in writing and executing R scripts for statistical analysis and data manipulation Proficient in Python programming language We‚Äôre looking for someone who: is Driven -- Want to be a part of a team where everyone is as driven as you? wants Growth -- And where those same talented people push you to grow professionally, and also personally? is Autonomous -- Are you someone that needs their hand held or someone that craves impact? can Problem-Solve -- Do you get motivated by bigger challenges? is Resilient -- Or someone who will still find a solution when things don't go your way? The Good Stuff: üí∏ Salary: 12K- 18K USD/Year üìà Professional development opportunities üíª Flexible working hours and remote opportunities - we‚Äôre outcome-oriented üöÄBecoming part of a fun and motivated multicultural team at a market-proven, fast-growing company Feel free to reach out for any role-related questions via hadi@algofy.com Think you're a good fit? Hit apply! We only accept applications through the application form. All applications should be made in English. We aim to create a company that promotes our employees‚Äô drive for growth and impact, a company that rewards employee resilience in the face of challenges and provides flexibility so long as the job gets done. Candidates who like autonomy over their work, have a growth mindset, and enjoy a dynamic working environment will be best suited to grow with us. At Algofy, we believe in shared values. We are committed to creating an inclusive and harassment free workplace as we believe diversity is the engine of innovation. We do not tolerate any discrimination due to race, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age, disability, pregnancy, or any other legally protected status. All qualified candidates are welcome to apply and join our team.

jobs_description: Apply now for a career that puts wellbeing first! GET TO KNOW US Gympass is a corporate wellness platform that connects you to thousands of fitness & wellness partners, all with one simple monthly membership. Founded in 2012 and headquartered in NYC, we have a growing global team in 11 offices around the world. At Gympass, you not only have the opportunity to build a career in a fast-paced global environment - but you'll make wellbeing universal, so everyone can be happy and healthy. THE OPPORTUNITY We are hiring a Data Analytics Specialist to our Martech team in Brazil! As a Data Services Specialist in our Martech team, you will contribute to creating an optimal view for driving Marketing Operations. Your role will involve assisting in the design and construction of various data models & products, including dashboards, KPIs, and statistical models, aimed at advancing our business objectives. You will also help in sharing data insights across teams to promote a data-driven culture within the organization. YOUR IMPACT Support the development and application of analytics, data mining, and statistical models to address business challenges and inform strategic decisions. Assist in designing, building, and maintaining data processing systems, focusing on accuracy and efficiency in data handling. Work with cross-functional teams to grasp business requirements and provide data-driven insights and recommendations. Contribute to developing and implementing data collection and analysis policies to enhance data quality and integrity. Participate in the analysis of the company‚Äôs data to identify trends, patterns, and insights. Help in creating and delivering reports and visualizations to share findings with various stakeholders. Contribute to the development and the evaluation of KPIs and metrics to analyze the success of data-driven initiatives and strategies. Live the mission: inspire and empower others by genuinely caring for your own wellbeing and your colleagues. Bring wellbeing to the forefront of work, and create a supportive environment where everyone feels comfortable taking care of themselves, taking time off, and finding work-life balance. Who You Are Experience in a data or business analytics role, demonstrating the ability to use data in making a business impact; Proficiency in data analysis tools and programming languages such as SQL, Python, R, or similar; as well as their specific data science libraries and tools such as Notebooks, NumPy, Pandas, Matplotlib, Seaborn, TensorFlow etc. Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, Metabase) for creating reports and dashboards; Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, able to interpret data and translate it into actionable insights; Good communication and storytelling skills, capable of effectively sharing findings with technical and non-technical stakeholders; Familiarity with machine learning techniques and their business applications; Ability to manage tasks and projects, with attention to detail and deadlines; Able to communicate in Advanced English; Bachelor's degree in any Data related field, Statistics, Computer Science, or relevant experience in a related field. We recognize that individuals approach job applications differently. We strongly encourage all aspiring applicants to go for it, even if they don't match the job description 100%. We welcome your application and will be delighted to explore if you could be a great fit for our team. For this specific role, please note that prior experience inin Data Analytics and Advanced English skills are mandatory requirements. What We Offer You We're a wellness company that is committed to the health and well-being of our employees. Our flexible program allows you to customize your benefits, according to your needs! Our Benefits Include WELLNESS: Health, dental, and life insurance. FLEXIBLE WORK: Choose when and where you work. For most, this will be a remote structure but can vary depending on the needs of the role and employee preferences. We offer all employees a home office stipend and a monthly flexible work allowance to help cover the costs of working from home. FLEXIBLE SCHEDULE: We understand that together, Gympassers and their leaders can make the best decisions for their own individual scopes. This includes flexibility to adjust their working hours based on their personal schedule, time zone, and business needs. GYMPASS: We believe in our mission and encourage our employees and their families to find their passion too. Access onsite gyms and fitness studios, digital fitness programs, and online wellness resources for meditation, nutrition, mental health support, and more. You will receive the Gold plan at no cost, and other premium plans will be significantly discounted. PAID TIME OFF: We know how important it is that our employees take time away from work to recharge. Vacations after 6 months and 3 days off per year + 1 day off for each year of tenure (up to 5 additional days) + extra day off for your birthday. PAID PARENTAL LEAVE: Welcoming a new child is one of the most special moments in your life and we want our employees to take the time to be present and enjoy their growing family. 100% paid parental leave of 6 weeks to all new parents, of both biological and adopted children, regardless of gender and parent's relationship with the co-parent, Also extended maternity leave under local legislation CAREER GROWTH: Outstanding opportunities for personal and career growth. That means we maintain a growth mindset in everything we do and invest deeply in employee development. CULTURE: An exciting and supportive atmosphere with ambitious people from around the world! You‚Äôll partner with global colleagues and share in the success of a high-growth technology company disrupting the health and wellness space. Our value-based culture of trust, flexibility, and integrity makes this possible every day. Find more info on our careers page! And to get a glimpse of Life at Gympass‚Ä¶ Follow us on Instagram @gympasscareers and LinkedIn ! Diversity, Equity, and Belonging at Gympass We aim to create a collaborative, supportive, and inclusive space where everyone knows they belong. Gympass is committed to creating a diverse work environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin, veteran status, or any other basis covered by appropriate law. Questions on how we treat your personal data? See our Job Applicant Privacy Notice.

jobs_description: Job Title: System Engineer III Location: Reston VA Onsite Onsite Requirements: Linux DevOps Proficient with writing services/task automation in Python, Bash, Ruby, Perl, JavaScript, or Java Job Description: We are looking for strong SRE's to take on the challenge of engineering infrastructure solutions for scale and performance while providing strong guarantees of availability to our customers. Your team will have diverse expertise in systems, networking, and software development to provide the stability, performance, and reliability our customers need. You will build tools to address hard operational problems while enabling our service developers to remain agile and deliver feature changes. You will deliver the solutions that directly contribute to our customer's success. A SRE will spend a significant amount of their time doing "ops" related work such as production issues and service on-call. When not working on operations the SRE is working on software engineering tasks such as design and development of systems that increase our reliability, scalability and reduce operational overhead through automation. The ideal SRE candidate is proficient programmer who has large breadth of knowledge and experience including areas such as networking, internet protocols and Linux systems. Our SREs are close partners with service owners in all aspects of service operations and ownership. We have a strong culture of innovation, collaboration and teamwork inspired by the DevOps philosophy. This role will support Client government customers. Responsibilities: Build systems to address hard operational problems such as automation, provisioning/deployment, security, scaling, availability, and resiliency - while enabling our service developers to remain agile and deliver feature changes. Value simplicity and usability as well as security and work comfortably in a collaborative, agile environment. Practice sustainable incident response and drive root case analysis. Take an active role in the definition and evolution of standard practices and procedures for our team and org. Deliver solutions that directly contribute to our customer's success. Work closely with development team on maintaining operational health of core compute services for API availability and low latency. Managing and triaging tickets. Driving prioritization and execution of work based on impact. Systems sustainably through mechanisms such as easy to use tooling and automation. Work in concert with service developers to evolve systems/products for better scalability, reliability, and development velocity. Drives new runbooks to help reduce mean triage time of incidents. Prioritize and automate high hit count runbooks. Minimum Qualifications: BS degree in Computer Science or related technical field involving coding or equivalent practical experience. Proficient with writing services/task automation in Python, Bash, Ruby, Perl, JavaScript, or Java. Proficient with communication skills (writing, organization, learning exchange) Familiarity with core protocols (DNS, DHCP, HTTP, TCP) Deep knowledge of Linux internals and host-based networking Expert Linux/Unix performance and stability troubleshooting skills. Familiarity with configuration management solutions such as Chef, Puppet, etc. Experience with devising, managing, and extending monitoring solutions for large scale environments. Experience in database management (Oracle DB, MYSQL, Postgres) Experience in shared file systems (Gluster, ZFS, etc.) Systematic problem-solving approach, strong communication skills, a sense of ownership and drive Deep understand of service metrics and alarms through the development of dashboards, service KPIs, alarming systems Experience working in an operational environment with mission critical tier one services with associated pager duty. 5+ years managing large scale, highly distributed, services infrastructures. 2+ years managing host virtualization technologies (KVM, Containers, Docker, etc.) Preferred Qualifications: Proficient in coding complex, distributed systems using Python, Ruby, Java, or C/C++ Deep knowledge of Networking (TCP, UDP, DNS, DHCP, IPSec) Deep focus on building secure Internet facing systems and services in hostile environments. 3+ years of experience in production software development with Agile methodologies 3+ years managing host, network, or storage virtualization technologies. Expert troubleshooting skills Expert fleet automation and management solutions.

Reporting to the VP, Business Analytics & Econometrics you will handle perfecting the end-to-end marketing funnel for the group's brands across digital and direct channels. Your mission is to work alongside our Business Management and Marketing partners to bring science to the development of the vision, strategy, and optimization of the campaign roadmap. Responsibilities of the Role: Establish a healthy reporting ecosystem in partnership with our VP of Marketing and regional business leads. Measure, report, and communicate the performance of the email and push channels and the CRM database. Partner with global and regional teams to develop hyper-localized global programs and channels strategies. Optimize the collection of data from diverse sources in partnership with ad-agency, Data Engineering, and IT Collect and build visibility into user behavior to make recommendations for audience and messaging enhancement Collaborate with Marketing team members to continuously improve effectiveness and efficiency via AB testing. Collaborate with Brand Marketing and IT to perfect and future proof our CRM and digital platforms. Top Performers will be able to demonstrate: Measurable consumer engagement impact through analysis, retrospective analysis or products built. Measurable revenue impact through research and retrospective analysis Measurable consumer experience impact through analysis, retrospective analysis or products built. Qualitative and quantitative deductions from experimentation that lead to product optimization. Knowledge of data collection, processing, and storage requirements for marketing. Ability to create thoughtful attribution logic and develop mechanisms to measure marketing attribution seamlessly. A bi-directional ‚Äúdata translator‚Äù who knows how to tell a story with data. Versed at discussing and defining requirements with IT based on business inputs. Commitment to upholding data privacy and data management best practices. Be able to work under minimal guidance while excelling in a collaborative team environment. Experience working with external data partners and agencies. Qualifications Solid years of experience in digital, direct, and marketing campaign analysis Bachelor‚Äôs degree or higher Expert technical skills, specifically in Salesforce and Google Analytics or other similar tools such as Adobe Analytics Strong skills in SQL, Python, or other data programming languages Experience with Power BI or other related visualization tools. Open-mindedness and team spirit are mandatory. Good storytelling and synthesis skills between science, marketing, and creativity You show initiative and have good interpersonal skills, passion and humanity first. Knowledge of JavaScript is a plus. Passion for software development and the automotive industry is a plus Your Platform A truly global company, we have headquarters in Amsterdam, Paris, Turin, and Auburn Hills. We also have technology hubs on the west coast of the United States, in Brazil, Poland and India. These locations are the nerve center of our company, where the best ideas combine with unrivaled rigor to create the biggest and best automotive experiences in the world. Our World Great mobility solutions start with great people! This is an exciting time to join us! Stellantis is a leading global mobility player guided by a clear mission: to provide freedom of movement for all through distinctive, appealing, affordable and sustainable mobility solutions. Our Company‚Äôs strength lies in the breadth of our iconic brand portfolio, the diversity and passion of our people, and our deep roots in the communities in which we operate. In this new era of mobility, our portfolio of brands is uniquely positioned to offer distinctive and sustainable solutions to meet the evolving needs of customers, as they embrace electrification, connectivity, autonomous driving and shared ownership. Founded by visionaries who infused them with passion and competitive spirit, these brands have made automotive history for more than a century and continue to speak to customers and inspire our employees today. The driving force behind us is the diverse and talented group of men and women around the world who bring their passion and experience to their work every day. And while we are a truly global organization, we remain deeply rooted in the communities in which we operate, and our people live and work.

jobs_description: Job Description ABS Interns are integrated into ABS business operations and will experience various aspects of engineering review, technical problem solving, and/or research and development. Interns will work with a designated advisor to learn and develop skills relating to ABS‚Äôs core business functions while also assisting ABS with key deliverables. It is expected that interns will be assigned multiple projects for their respective departments throughout the course of their internship. What You Will Do: The primary function of an intern is to develop skills and knowledge of ABS core business functions including but not limited to: Engineering Plan Review. Technical Plan Review. Research and Product Development. Operational Safety and Evaluation. Data Science and Digital Services Interns may provide engineering support in the form of design review and analysis assignments typically involving a major project or several smaller, less complex projects. Projects will vary in complexity and difficulty. Under the supervision of an experienced engineer or engineering manager, interns may assist with a detailed engineering review of plans as assigned for compliance with applicable Rules, Regulations, and contract commitments. Communicate the status of the current workload to all appropriate members of the team to ensure that the needs of the clients will be met. May propose technical advice to field operations and other technical offices. May propose new approaches to problems encountered and make recommendations for changes in methods, procedures, or designs. May assist in the development of business performance metrics including the development and implementation of an ongoing business performance monitoring program, and the periodic analysis of operating results to determine causes, trends, etc. May assist with the writing and presentation of technical papers and reports concerning areas of expertise and work performed. May assist with Rule development projects as assigned. Interns may collaborate with the digital team and with other departments such as services, class, project management, commercial operations, etc. Intern may assist with data collection efforts for data quality improvement, in both existing and new data streams to support overall business goals. What You Will Need: Education and Experience Applicants must be working towards an engineering degree at an accredited school; Basic engineering knowledge and proficiency in Excel and AutoCAD are preferred. Must be a full-time student currently enrolled in an accredited university and pursuing a BS, MS, or Ph.D. degree in one of the following engineering disciplines: Chemical Engineer; Obtain a working knowledge of the ABS Health, Safety, Quality, and Environmental Management System. Reporting Relationships: This position does not have any direct reports. About Us We set out more than 160 years ago to promote the security of life and property at sea and preserve the natural environment. Today, we remain true to our mission and continue to support organizations facing a rapidly evolving seascape of challenging regulations and new technologies. Through it all, we are anchored by a vision and mission that help our clients find clarity in uncertain times. ABS is a global leader in marine and offshore classification and other innovative safety, quality, and environmental services. We‚Äôre at the forefront of supporting the global energy transition at sea, the application of remote and autonomous marine systems, cutting-edge technical solutions, and many more exciting advancements. Our commitment to safety, reliability, and efficiency is ever-present, guiding our clients to safer and more efficient operations. Equal Opportunity The ABS Group of Companies is committed to the equal employment opportunity of its employees and prohibits discrimination against any employee or qualified applicant based on race, color, creed, religion, national origin, sex, gender identity, age, disability, marital status, sexual orientation, citizenship status or veteran status, or other non-work-related characteristics that may be protected under the law of the Federal Government or specific state employment laws. Notice ABS and Affiliated Companies (ABS) will not pay a fee to any third-party agency without a valid ABS Master Service Agreement (MSA) authorized and signed by Human Resources. Any resume, CV, application, or other forms of candidate submission provided to any employee of ABS without a valid MSA on file will be considered property of ABS, and no fee will be paid. Other This job description is not intended, and should not be construed, to be an all-inclusive list of responsibilities, skills, efforts or working conditions associated with the job of the incumbent. It is intended to be an accurate reflection of the principal job elements essential for making a fair decision regarding the pay structure of the job. #ogjs
